name: Sonora, California
description: A historic city in California known for its rich gold rush history and as a popular filming location.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Sonora, California is a city located in the Sierra Nevada foothills. Founded during the California Gold Rush, it has retained much of its historic charm with a number of preserved 19th-century structures. Today, Sonora serves as the county seat of Tuolumne County and acts as a regional service center. Its authentic historic ambiance, combined with scenic landscapes, makes it a favored spot for filmmakers.

content.title: Film History
content.body: Sonora has been the backdrop for numerous film and television productions, especially Westerns and period pieces. Notable films shot in Sonora include **"Back to the Future Part III"**, where the city's historic aesthetic was ideally suited for the film's 1885 Hill Valley setting.

content.title: Visiting
content.body: Visitors to Sonora can enjoy a vibrant downtown area filled with antique shops, eateries, and the historic Sonora Opera Hall. It is publicly accessible and offers a variety of walking tours that showcase its rich history and connection to the film industry. Nestled near natural attractions like Yosemite National Park, it also serves as a great base for outdoor adventurers.
